instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG? This is battery power that flows to the system AFTER it has gone through a current sense resistor, before it goes through a fuse to become PPBUS_G3H power rail. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Hi
I, have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that that doesn't power on.

It has no greenlight, no fan spin, and only puls 0.2A from bench PSU.

I don't have <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> (0V), but I don't think that is shorted (diode reading is 0.125 and 8Kohm of resistance to ground).

F7140 seams to be OK.

On L7130 I get 0.66V

On <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG</SIGNAL> I get 0.123 on diode measurement

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Do you get <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL>?
Tried fake charger, or lab PSU?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

IÂ´m using lab PSU, and on  <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>  and  <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL>  I get 19.90V

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Don't you have original charger?
Did you even read the voltage delivered by original 60W charger?
Is marked on it.
Why the people like to always inject 20V with lab PSU on the Apple machines?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
OK, understood.

I don't have an origibal charger. With 16.5V on lab PSU, I get 16.43V on  <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> and  <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
It was the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>. pin1was shorted and after replacement it started to work again.
TKS

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Afetr all, it is not ok, yet...

Now I have ower, but it is giving me 3 beeps. What can I check to try to figure out if thw problem is CPU ou RAM? Can it be anything else?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
This model isn't known for such issue.
You can try to reflow the RAMs, until make them dance a bit.
